H0.text: One meter is the distance at which Daphnee would need to place Earth from the Sun in her solarâ€‘system model, where one meter represents one astronomical unit.

H1.text: Two meters is the distance Daphnee must place Earth from the Sun in her model, since one meter represents one astronomical unit (AU).

H2.text: Three meters is the distance from the Sun at which Earth would be placed in Daphnee's model of the solar system, given that she uses a scale of one meter to represent one astronomical unit.

H3.text: Four meters is the distance Daphnee would need to place Earth from the Sun in her model of the solar system, where one meter represents one astronomical unit.

A4.text: The astronomical unit is defined as exactly 149597870700 metres.

A5.text: Earth orbits the Sun at an average distance of 149.60 million km (92.96 million mi), or 8.317 light-minutes.
